ีีฅึีปีฅึีฝ ีฌีธีตีฝ ีฟีฅีฝีกึ ีีกีตีธึ ีีฅีฒีกีฝีบีกีถีธึีฉีฅีกีถ ีฉีกีถีฃีกึีกีถ-ีฐีซีดีถีกึีฏีซ ีถีกีญีกีฑีฅีผีถีธึีฉีฅีกีดีข ีฐึีกีฟีกึีกีฏีธึีธีฒ ยซีีกีตีธึ ีีฅีฒีกีฝีบีกีถีธึีฉีซึีถีจ ีพีฅึีกีบึีกีฎีถีฅึีซ ีตีธึีทีกีฃึีธึีฉีซึีถีถีฅึยป ีดีกีฟีฅีถีกีทีกึีซ 8-ึีค ีกีทีกีญีกีฟีธึีฉีซึีถีจี ยซีีกึีกีฃึีซ ีตีธึีทีฅึ 1915-1917ยป ีพีฅึีถีกีฃีซึีจ ีฏึีธีฒ ิณีกีผีถีซีฏ ิฟ. ีึ ีฟีธึีผีฅีกีถีซ ีตีธึีทีกีฃึีธึีฉีซึีถีจึ ิฑีตีฝ ีกีผีซีฉีธีพ ยซิถีกึีฏีฅึีกีฏยป-ีซ ีฐีกีฒีธึีคีกีพีกึ ิฑึีงีถ ีีฅึีฉีฅีทีฅีกีถ ีฆึีธึึีฅึ ีถีทีฅีกีฌ ีฃีซึึีซ ีญีดีขีกีฃึีซีถี ึีฅีฒีกีฝีบีกีถีกีฃีงีฟ ีีซีฐึีกีถ ีีซีถีกีฝีฅีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟึ

media:group.media:description:
Suren Manukyan, the Head of the Department of Comparative Genocide Studies at the Armenian Genocide Museum and Institute, sat down with CivilNetโs Emilio Cricchio to discuss how the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war and its aftermath have affected the Armenian peopleโs perception and attitude toward the genocide. entry.title: Business Week Armenia: Government expands tax breaks for IT sector

media:group.media:title: Business Week Armenia: Government expands tax breaks for IT sector
media:group.media:description:
In this weekโs edition of CivilNetโs business digest:
๐The government approved plans to expand a scheme providing tax breaks for IT firms, bringing the total amount of pledged support under that program to nearly $16.5 million. ๐Wine exports soared to nearly $36.5 million last year, with about 80% of the exports destined for Russia, while the number of winemaking companies rose to 150. ๐A government watchdog fined three dairy producers a total of about $33,000 for anticompetitive practices, amid talks over Russiaโs ban on Armenian dairy products.

entry.title: Pashinyanโs cabinet greenlights plans for women to serve in army

media:group.media:title: Pashinyanโs cabinet greenlights plans for women to serve in army
media:group.media:description:
๐Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyanโs cabinet approved a proposal allowing women to serve for six months in Armeniaโs army on a voluntary basis in exchange for about $2,600 in compensation. ๐The cabinet also greenlighted the creation of a new government body to implement the Pashinyan administrationโs plans to establish a major university complex outside of Yerevan. ๐A State Department spokesperson told reporters the United States will โcontinue to be deeply engagedโ in Armenia and Azerbaijan, while declining to provide โany specific updates.โ
